14: Angels at Christ's Baptism and in the Wilderness

Christ's Baptism
     When Jesus came to be baptized, John recognized in Him a purity of character that he had never before perceived in any man. . . . As Jesus asked for baptism, John drew back exclaiming, \93I have need to be baptized of Thee, and comest Thou to me?\94 With firm yet gentle authority, Jesus answered, \93Suffer it to be so now: for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness.\94 And John, yielding, led the Saviour down into the Jordan, and buried Him beneath the water. \93And straightway coming up out of the water,\94 Jesus \93saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon Him.\94\97DA 110, 111.
